body.p: includes a file merge tool. It can be activated in several ways:

ul.li:
Using the More... (triple dots) Compare with... Latest version from repository action in the toolbar of a regular editor.
This action opens the merge dialog if the editor is not read-only and if the file is not part of a concurrent editing session. Otherwise the file comparison tool is opened.
After you close the dialog, the changes you merged in the left file are synchronized to the main editor.
When committing a file in a Git repository, if there is a conflict.

body.p: The Merge tool presents two files that will be merged. The one on the left is editable and will contain the merged content. Differences between files are highlighted and the user ca navigate among them. If a base file is provided, the tool will perform a 3-way diff algorithm.
To merge the changes one can use the following functions:

ul.li: An action to copy a change or a block of changes from the right file to the left one.
An action to copy all changes from the right file to the left one. If a 3-way merge is performed and the editor identified conflicts, the action will copy all non-conflicting changes.

Manually editing in the left file, including features like:
Text editing
Inserting new elements using the Content Completion menu (triggered when pressing Enter).
Cut, Copy, and Paste content. These actions can be invoked either by their standard shortcuts or from the contextual menu.
A find and replace dialog.
Actions to add and remove attributes.
Undo and Redo changes.

body.p: After making changes in the left file, the new differences between the two files may be created. The visual highlights of these differences ca become out-of-date. By default, the visual highlights are updated automatically when the user makes changes to the document.

For large documents, this update can take long and affect the user experience, so the editor can be configured to disable this behavior using the &runDiffOnChange=false URL parameter. In this case, a Re-compute Differences button appears on the toolbar to update the visual highlights.
